If you are thinking of buying this phone then my review will give you some honest advice.

CAMERA:- The camera is just ok. I don't know why all the youtubers were saying that camera was excellent. I found it ok. The only great thing about the camera is that you can record 4k in 60fps.

Display:- Display is not amoled. But you can never say that the display is poor. I even find it better than some of the amoled displays on mid range redmi and realme phones. But on full brightness you can feel the videos are gray. The display size is insanely small that is 4.7 inches.

Design:- The design is old but not outdated. The phone is tough. Dropping it will not break it easily. This phone feels so much premium in hands. This is the phone you don't want to put somewhere. You always want to keep it in your hands. The design is a little old but awesome.

Performance:- With the A13 Bionic Chipset this phone is way ahead of all the other phones in this price section. You can run any app which is possible to run on a phone. Its one of the most powerful phones in the market right now. You can compare its performance with any flagship of any company.

Price:- Since i got this for Rs26,000 during the sale i will say this is the best thing you can get at this price.

Let me clear this question first

Do we get the adapter and earphones ? Yes , the box contains the earphones and the charging adapter along with the cable

Now coming to the mobile, this is an excellent mobile overall.
1. For those who wants to move from Android to iOS this would be the best purchase as a first time experience.
2. The design is excellent. It's pretty sleek and pretty light weight. I have purchased Product (RED) and it's just brilliant
3. Processor is like damn fast. No lags nothing. Just premium
4. Cameras are top notch. Night mode is just good, but just think how many times you would click pictures at night ? The pictures in the daylight are just excellent.Portrait shots are on par with many high end phones
5. The size of the phone is what I love the most. Vexed up with the bigger phones, this is a life saver. So easy to hold and use
6. iOS - This is the biggest pro of any iPhone and this one too. The new security features that are given in the latest iOS14 are no match to the Android Security. Just brilliant

Battery might be a major concern for many, but I get a screen time of around 6-7 hours which I believe should be more than enough. Why do you want to use a phone for more than 7 hours per day. Haha

Other noteworthy things - You get a 1 year of apple tv plus subscription and 1 year of warranty

The only issue I have faced is with activating iMessage and Facetime but the apple support damn its so good that I have got it resolved within a day or so.

Do whatever you do perfectly - This phone redefines it. Go for it
You can just show off with this no doubt about it

I am a first time iPhone user. I've been using android since Android 2.3. I'm still using Android through Samsung Galaxy Note 8 as my primary phone.

So my review should help any prospective iPhone users to make the right decision.

Overall summary - A good phone to begin your iPhone experience. I bought it during BBD festival offer & for the phone for Rs28000 after discount. No I didn't exchange any phone for it. Ordered on Thursday night around 11pm. Phone delivered Saturday afternoon.

Pros.
1. Size - 4/5 I was apprehensive first to buy 4.7" screen iphone since I was using big screen of Note 8. But to my surprise, the phone is not that small as I imagined. It's compact & the screen size is also good enough. Initially, the experience would be different but nevertheless it would be a good experience. The bezel is the only slight which could have been avoided. But this is iphone 8 except for the internal specs change. So just a small compromise.

2. Display - 5/5 I couldn't notice any difference between iPhone's LCD display & the Samsung's LED display with naked eye observations under normal conditions for any user.. Obviously, at maximum resolution & maximum brightness, Samsung display was way better. But I'm not going to use the phone in that settings & conditions. So it doesn't matter. The display is clear. Colors are vivid. Truetone technology definetly gives more accurate skin tones. Best display at this price. (please note the expert reviews and ratings that you see in YouTube are all based on extreme settings and not based on normal user settings & conditions.)

3. Camera - 5/5 this is the same primary camera from iPhone 11. It's an iPhone camera. So definetly it is different. Even the expert reviews in YouTube have concluded the same. Except for some very minute details missing. But that's OK. This is below 30k phone. Iphone 11 is atleast a 50k phone. So no complaints whatsoever.

4. Performance - 4/5.the processor & ram are is the same as iPhone 11. So it's supposed to be the best performance. But it's just that after I've been using Galaxy Note 8 for nearly 3 years, I felt the phone is slightly slower. But it is obvious to expect because Note 8 has a Octa core processor. iPhone se 2020 has a hexa core processor. But in a week or so, you'll get used to the pace of the phone and it won't be a problem. (please note there is no Octa core iphone) . The latest iPhone 12 is also hexa-core. So performance cannot be compared. Youtube comparisons are not for normal layman user experience. They'll use the phone for 2 weeks and will post a review and then will never use the phone. But you're buying a new phone to use it for atleast next 3 years of its an iPhone

5. OS - 3/5 - this is the biggest disappointment of all. Except for so called "privacy" & "security", there is nothing that I found good in iOS 14. If everything was uploaded to icloud and as we have seen in the past, icloud is hackable I don't understand how is it secure. Especially transferring selective data from Android to iPhone, file management, photos management, cloud back up management & app library management are some of the things I found very difficult to do. Transferring photos into iPhone externally is one of the harrowing experience I have gone through recently. If this is your first ever smartphone, then this is the best phone. But if you are coming from nearly a decade of Android experience with obviously considerable amount of data, iOS will frustrate you plenty of times. In my opinion, iOS is absolutely not at all a welcoming & user friendly OS whatsoever. May be in long run you will get used to it.

In conclusion, anybody who wants to experience an iPhone & then decide whether to buy a Rs1lac phone 2-3 years down the time, then go for it.. Have the experience & then decide for yourselves.. Low expectations will definitely help you a long way.

I bought SE 2020 from flipkart bbd and i got it at a very good price. I have always used android but i must say that SE is far better than most of the android mobile which comes in this price segment. Some of the issues that people have with SE 2020 and my view on that issues:
1.Battery - I think that battery life is pretty decent. It lasts full day for me. I use my mobile for social media apps, youtube ,music, prime and all the other basic mobile functions. I am not a heavy mobile gamer so battery is not a problem for me.
2. Screen size and bazzels : I feel that the bazzels are big but that is the thing i already know before buying. so its totally your decision if you like bazzels or not, but the screen quality beats many hd and full hd screens available in market. Thumbs up for that.
3. Gaming : This device is not for heavy gamers although every game runs perfectly without any frame drop but the screen size is the problem. Lite games can be played easily.
What are the things that I like the most?
1. First of all the mobile is launched in 2020 so i will get ios update at least for next 4 years.
2. I don't know about previous IOS versions but ios 14 is awesome. It is the whole package. It comes with so much cool features like shortcuts, double tap, triple tap gesture from the back etc. definitely check them out or watch some video you will get the idea.
3. It is light weight and can be operated via single hand.
4. Camera performance is next level. You might have already heard about iphone cameras(don't go on megapixel of camera).
5. It has many other advantages like security, privacy, no hickups , best ram management etc.

Haven’t tested the camera yet, hence the low camera rating. Actually with the NeuralCam application from the AppStore, you can take pretty good low-light photographs. Other than that, in good lighting, the camera takes some premium clicks/captures.

Insane phone, insane user experience as is the case is with all Apple products. Feels extremely premium. It’s a proper work/business phone. Not good for content consumption or games, only because of the small screen size. If you can live with it, then it’s 100% fine.

Battery is not that bad as everyone claims it is. Yes it’s not that good, but with the iPhone you don’t have to use your phone a lot to get work done, and it’s standby time is incredible. So in that sense, the battery life seems pretty okay.

Overall a good business/work phone, if all you want is seamless performance and a good user experience. It gets all the basics right.

pros.Camera: The 12MP rear camera and 7MP front camera is the best and gives awesome picture quality.
pros.Performance: This phone comes with A13 bionic chip that gives blazing speed and reliable performance with no lags whatsoever.
pros.11.94-cm (4.7) Retina HD display: The 11.94-cm (4.7) Retina HD display is brilliant and provides an enhanced user experience.

cons.Battery: The battery of this phone is not 13 hours as promised on full charge. It gets drained within 4 hours and not ideal for long duration use.
cons.Screen size: The screen size of this phone is just 4.7 inch which seems to be short as per the cost of the phone.

summary.verdict: The Apple iPhone SE is small yet powerful and an absolute beast of a device. Perfect pick for new iPhone users.
summary.Additional Information: Supports heavy games, No lags, Dust proof and water resistant.
